revised_title: Long-Term Prediction of Orbital Elements and Position in Satellite Orbits
tldr: The authors discuss the challenges of predicting the orbital elements and position of satellites, particularly in the presence of air drag and solar radiation pressure. They present methods for calculating these effects and demonstrate improvements in predicting orbital elements and the time a satellite will pass through a given point in its orbit. This research is relevant for understanding and planning satellite-based research projects.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Atmospheric Science
